intro: Brachyscome marginata var. chrysoglossa, commonly known as the golden-leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and the plant is well adapted to dry, sandy soils. It is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and inland regions.
